DEATHS #

metadata.title: Erowid Oxycodone Vault : Health
metadata.description: Information on health affects and concerns related to Oxycodone (Xanax).

content:
Drug: Oxycodone | cid: 5284603
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on health affects and concerns related to Oxycodone (Xanax).
Erowid name: oxycodone
Category: PHARMS
Field: Health

                    Text: 
                    Contact

PHARMS

oxycodone



New, Vintage, and Signed Blotter Art

Contribute $50 or more and get a piece of displayable blotter art. These look great framed on the wall !

DEATHS #

Respiratory arrest and death stemming from overdose or drug combinations involving oxycodone is the most serious health concern from oxycodone use . Deaths from oxycodone alone or in combination with other CNS depressants [data?] Although the death rate from opioids increased between 1999 and 2011, the rate of increase has slowed since 2006.[1]

WARNINGS #

Respiratory Depression. Respiratory depression from taking too much oxycodone or mixing it with other CNS depressants can have life-threatening consequences. [grabbed from Alcohol Health] Seek medical attention if : The person is unconscious and cannot be wakened Breathing is irregular and/or shallow You suspect oxycodone has been mixed with other drugs Skin is clammy or pale


                    Context: 
                    This chunk appears within Erowid's informational page on oxycodone under the Pharmaceuticals section, following general site navigation and donation information. It provides critical health and safety information, including death statistics, overdose risks, and urgent warnings regarding respiratory depression and dangerous drug interactions associated with oxycodone use.

metadata.title: Erowid Oxycodone Vault : Health
metadata.description: Information on health affects and concerns related to Oxycodone (Xanax).

content:
Drug: Oxycodone | cid: 5284603
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on health affects and concerns related to Oxycodone (Xanax).
Erowid name: oxycodone
Category: PHARMS
Field: Health

                    Text: 
                    Depressant Combinations. Avoid other depressants (alcohol, benzos, opiates, some dissociatives) in combination with oxycodone, which can increase respiratory depressions risks.

Oxycodone is Addicting. Oxycodone is an opiate and, as with most opiates, is addicting. Some people find opiates very appealing and with even moderate use, can find themselves using more than they want to. With regular use, the body becomes physically dependent upon the substance, causing withdrawal symptoms if use is ceased.

Oxycodone Causes Tolerance. Those who use Oxycodone for many days in a row report that they begin to require a higher dose for the same effects. Beware of dosages recommended by an individual who uses Oxycodone regularly as their dose could be dangerous for a non-user due to tolerance.

CAUTIONS #


                    Context: 
                    This chunk appears in an Erowid informational page about oxycodone within the Pharmaceuticals section. It provides key warnings and cautions related to oxycodone use, specifically highlighting the dangers of combining oxycodone with other depressants, the drug's addictive potential, the development of tolerance with repeated use, and general safety cautions for users.

metadata.title: Erowid Oxycodone Vault : Health
metadata.description: Information on health affects and concerns related to Oxycodone (Xanax).

content:
Drug: Oxycodone | cid: 5284603
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on health affects and concerns related to Oxycodone (Xanax).
Erowid name: oxycodone
Category: PHARMS
Field: Health

                    Text: 
                    CAUTIONS #

Frequent or increased use. Many people have reported using more oxycodone than they intended. Often this takes the form of continuing to redose repeatedly after they had planned to stop, or taking more oxycodone to achieve the same effects.

Constipation.Using opiates like oxycodone can cause constipation.

Hyperalgesia stemming from chronic use. Some people report a heightened sensitivity to pain after prolonged use of opiates.

References #

"Drug-poisoning Deaths Involving Opioid Analgesics: United States, 1999â€“2011". NCHS Data Brief 166. September 2014.

                    This chunk appears after the "WARNINGS" section on an Erowid page about oxycodone, providing additional cautions related to its use, including risks of frequent or increased dosing, constipation, and hyperalgesia, followed by references and copyright information.
